channel.title: Auto Clicker?
channel.description: Umm, I haven't done scripting in a long time and I can't remember crap lol...especially not with this Divi stuff...but I've been playing a game called 2Moons, and instead of having to use the mouse to move around and search for a monster, is there like a way to push like an "F" key and then it automatically finds the colors of the monster then clicks on it once? I would really appreciate it :P (So basically a color-finder that doesn't activate until you press like an "F" key.) ;D

item.title: Auto Clicker?
item.dc:creator: @GoF GoF
item.description:
@GoF wrote:

Yea… Made this in about 1 minute 

program New;

const
  Col = 0; // Color to click.
  Tol = 5; // Tolerance.
  AKey = 'f'; // Key to "activate" colorfinding.

var
  x, y, Ax, Ay: Integer;

begin
  GetClientDimensions(Ax, Ay);
  while True do
  begin
    if IsKeyDown(AKey) then
    begin
      if FindColorTolerance(x, y, Col, 0, 0, Ax, Ay, Tol) then
        ClickMouse(x, y, True)
      else
        Wait(100);
    end else
      Wait(35);
  end;
end.

Just searches the whole client window for the color if you press ‘f’… And if color is found then the script will click it.

Read full topic
